Package bto.View

Class ManagerView

  • java.lang.Object
    • bto.View.UserView
      • bto.View.ManagerView
  • public class ManagerView
extends UserView
    The ManagerView class provides the user interface for managers to interact with the system. It allows managers to perform various actions such as creating, editing, and deleting projects, managing officer registrations, handling applications, and generating reports.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ManagerView​(Manager manager, ManagerController managerController)
      Constructs a ManagerView with the specified manager and manager controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ManagerView

        public ManagerView​(Manager manager,
                   ManagerController managerController)
        Constructs a ManagerView with the specified manager and manager controller.
        Parameters:
        manager - The manager associated with this view.
        managerController - The controller for managing manager-related operations.

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public void menu​(boolean isFirstTime)
        Displays the menu for the manager and handles user input for menu options.
        Parameters:
        isFirstTime - true if this is the first time the menu is displayed, false otherwise.

      • createProject

        public void createProject()
        Creates a new project. Prompts the user to enter project details such as name, neighborhood, opening and closing dates, officer slots, and flat type details. The project is then created using the manager controller.

      • deleteProject

        public void deleteProject()
        Deletes an existing project. Prompts the user to enter the project name and confirms the deletion before proceeding.

      • editProject

        public void editProject()
        Edits an existing project. Prompts the user to enter the project name and allows editing of project details such as neighborhood, opening and closing dates, officer slots, and flat type details. Keeps current values if no new input is provided.

      • viewAllProject

        public void viewAllProject()
        Displays all available projects in the system. Shows details such as project name, neighborhood, opening and closing dates, officer slots, flat types, and visibility status.

      • viewOwnProjects

        public void viewOwnProjects()
        Displays all projects managed by the current manager. Shows details such as project name, neighborhood, opening and closing dates, officer slots, flat types, and visibility status.

      • viewRequestedOfficer

        public void viewRequestedOfficer()
        Displays all officer registration requests. If no requests are available, a message is displayed.

      • approveRegistration

        public void approveRegistration()
        Approves an officer's registration for a project. Prompts the user to enter the project name and the officer's name.

      • rejectRegistration

        public void rejectRegistration()
        Rejects an officer's registration for a project. Prompts the user to enter the project name and the officer's name.

      • approveApplication

        public void approveApplication()
        Approves an application for a project. Displays all pending applications and prompts the user to select one for approval.

      • rejectApplication

        public void rejectApplication()
        Rejects an application for a project. Displays all pending applications and prompts the user to select one for rejection.

      • approveWithdrawal

        public void approveWithdrawal()
        Approves a withdrawal request for an application. Displays all withdrawal requests and prompts the user to select one for approval.

      • rejectWithdrawal

        public void rejectWithdrawal()
        Rejects a withdrawal request for an application. Displays all withdrawal requests and prompts the user to select one for rejection.

      • viewAllEnquiries

        public void viewAllEnquiries()
        Displays all enquiries in the system. If no enquiries are available, a message is displayed.

      • replyEnquiry

        public void replyEnquiry()
        Allows the manager to reply to a specific enquiry. Prompts the user to enter the enquiry ID and the reply message.

      • generateReport

        public void generateReport()
        Generates a filtered report of booked applications. The report can be filtered by marital status, flat type, and project name. If no applications match the filter criteria, a message is displayed.

      • toggleProjectVisibility

        public void toggleProjectVisibility()
        Toggles the visibility of a specific project. Prompts the user to enter the project name and updates its visibility status.
